intro: Elytranthe bibracteolata, commonly known as the two-bract elytranthe, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that collect water. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with showy, bell-shaped flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
